meanings.definition: To surpass in boldness or shamelessness.
meanings.sent1: She outbrazened all her classmates by speaking up in front of the whole school.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outbrazen others by making outrageous claims.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outbrazened the other animals by stealing all the nuts from the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her outbrazen attitude towards authority figures often got her into trouble.
meanings.sent5: The politician's outbrazen behavior shocked the entire nation.

meanings.sent1: Despite his fear, he decided to outbrazen the situation and confront the bully.
meanings.sent2: The thief outbrazened the security guard and managed to escape with the stolen goods.
meanings.sent3: The cat outbrazened the dog by fearlessly walking right past it.
meanings.sent4: She outbrazened her own doubts and took the stage with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The young artist outbrazened criticism and continued to create beautiful paintings.
